intro: Tetratheca gunnii, commonly known as the Gunns tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
